Class ManFunctions

java.lang.Object
  ManFunctions

public class ManFunctions
extends java.lang.Object

ManFunctions (Manual/Manipulation Function) class contains re-usable methods which generally manipulate Strings and also check their content.

Author:
Jamie Brindle (06352322) - Msc - Manchester Metropolitan University

Method Detail

sortWeeks

protected java.lang.String sortWeeks(java.util.Vector<java.lang.Integer> weeksVector)
The database doesn't contain a list of weeks for a particular subject so a query has to be done on the database to see which week is associated with each question which comes back as a large list with lots of duplicate week numbers. This method removes the duplicate and as a header 'week' to each week item and returns it as a single string with each week seperated via the colon (:) symbol

Parameters:
weeksVector - is the vector containing the full list of raw weeks
Returns:
weeksList - The string containing the sorted weeks

readFile

protected java.lang.String[] readFile(java.lang.String fileName)
Reads the contents of an entire text file into a single String and returns an array

Parameters:
fileName - is the filename and location of the text file we want to read
Returns:
inputArray each index of the array contains a line of the text file

Takes a String and splits it where the particular character is found and is stored in an array.

Parameters:

items which is an array

containsOnlyNumbers

public boolean containsOnlyNumbers(java.lang.String aString)
Takes a String and and tests whether it contains only numeral digits or not returning a boolean value

Parameters:
aString - is the string we want to split
Returns:
true if the string only contains numbers
